modules.description: This module implements the PBKDF1 and PBKDF2 key derivation functions using a provided hash module. It takes a password, salt, iteration count, and desired key length to produce a derived key string. It is used to securely generate cryptographic keys from passwords, such as for encryption or authentication protocols.

This module implements PBKDF1 and PBKDF2 key derivation functions as defined in RFC 2898, producing cryptographic keys from passwords and salts. It operates on strings for passwords and salts, with iteration counts and desired key lengths, returning derived keys as strings. It is used to securely derive encryption keys or authentication tokens from user-provided passwords.

This module implements PBKDF1 and PBKDF2 key derivation functions, generating cryptographic keys from passwords and salts using a specified hash function. It supports direct control over iteration counts and key length, operating on strings for all inputs and outputs. The child modules provide concrete implementations based on RFC 2898, enabling secure derivation of encryption keys or authentication tokens. Example usage includes transforming a user password and salt into a fixed-length key for AES encryption or HMAC generation.
